intro: Clarkia tembloriensis, commonly known as Temblor Clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as hillsides and meadows. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
